title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) — In a season destined for the lottery, the San Antonio Spurs found a piece of forever. On a night when the basketball world anticipated another chapter in David Robinson’s storied career, it was a soft-spoken rookie from the U.S. Virgin Islands who authored a legend, pouring in a mind-boggling 47 points to will the Spurs to a breathtaking 106-105 victory over the Dallas Mavericks.

From the opening tip, this was not a normal game. It was the Tim Duncan Show. The No. 1 overall pick was unstoppable, a study in quiet efficiency amid the roaring chaos. He didn’t just score; he dominated every facet of the game, finishing with 47 points, 12 rebounds, 5 assists, 2 steals, and 2 blocks. He was the epicenter of every Spurs possession, a force both in the paint and from the perimeter.

Dallas, led by a valiant 26-point effort from Michael Finley, had no answer. They traded blows with the Spurs all night, but every time the Mavericks threatened to seize momentum, there was Duncan with a calming turnaround jumper, a powerful post move, or a crucial rebound.

The game culminated in a final, frantic possession. With the score 106-105 and the seconds evaporating, the Mavericks’ last-gasp shot clanged off the iron. The rebound was fiercely contested, a scrum of bodies fighting for one last chance. But the ball found its way safely to the floor as the final horn sounded, sealing the historic win.

The AlamoDome erupted, not just for a victory, but for the arrival of a superstar. On this night, Tim Duncan wasn’t just a rookie; he was a revelation, announcing his greatness with a 47-point masterpiece that instantly became the foundation of a new Spurs dynasty.
